POLYGLOT.GameMasterHasAssignedCharacter: You are a {GM} and have a character assigned to you. Polyglot will behave weirdly because of that. Consider unassigning that character from your User.
POLYGLOT.Languages.title: Languages
POLYGLOT.Languages.hint: Changes the alphabet used for the languages.
POLYGLOT.AllowOOC.hint: Choose which users should have their messages scrambled. OOC = Out of Character.
POLYGLOT.AllowOOC.title: Scramble OOC Chat Messages

Omniglot.title: Omniglot Language
Omniglot.hint: Set a language whose speaker understands and speaks all other languages. An actor will be able to read and write in all other languages, both on chat and on journals.

POLYGLOT.ComprehendLanguages.hint: Set a language whose speaker understands all other languages, but that can't be spoken or written. An actor will be able to read all chat messages and journal text.
POLYGLOT.ComprehendLanguages.title: Omniscient Language
POLYGLOT.CustomLanguages.hint: Define a list of custom languages to add to the system. They must be separated by commas or semicolons.
POLYGLOT.CustomLanguages.title: Custom Languages
POLYGLOT.DefaultLanguage.hint: Name of the default language to select. Keep empty to use system default.
POLYGLOT.DefaultLanguage.title: Default Language
POLYGLOT.DisplayTranslated.hint: For languages that are translated in the chat window, display the original text and a translation below.
POLYGLOT.DisplayTranslated.title: Display Translations

enableAllFonts.hint: Add Foundry's fonts to the {setting1} and {setting2}.
enableAllFonts.title: Add Foundry's fonts to {settingMenuLabel}

POLYGLOT.ExportFonts.hint: Add Polyglot's fonts to Core's {settingMenuLabel} menu. Toggle this setting off to remove all of Polyglot's fonts from the menu.
POLYGLOT.ExportFonts.title: Add Polyglot's fonts to Core
POLYGLOT.HideTranslation.hint: Hides the Globe and the "Translated from" text from chat messages to players. Useful for when you don't want to show players which language you are speaking. Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.HideTranslation.title: Hide Indicators from Players

IgnoreJournalFontSize.hint: Ignores the size of Polyglot's fonts on journals, making them have the same size as normal text would have. Useful for when the formatting of the journal matters.
IgnoreJournalFontSize.title: Use Normal Font Size

JournalHighlight.hint: Defines the opacity of the highlight over fonts on the journal.
JournalHighlight.title: Highlight Opacity (%)

JournalHighlightColor.hint: Defines the color of the highlight over fonts on the journal.
JournalHighlightColor.title: Highlight Color

LanguageProvider.hint: Select who provides language information for alphabets and languages. More language providers can be made available via game systems and installed modules. The options below are dependent upon the language provider selected here. ⚠️ If you change the provider, you have to save and reopen these settings.
LanguageProvider.name: Language Settings Provider

languageDataPath.title: Language Data Path
languageDataPath.hint: If your system has languages set in actors' data and aren't being loaded properly, it might be using another data path. Input the data path to the correct attribute (e.g. actor.system.languages or actor.system.speak). This settings takes precedence over the {setting} setting. Requires reload.

literacyDataPath.title: Literacy Data Path
literacyDataPath.hint: Same as the {setting} setting, but for reading journals. This settings requires the {setting} setting. Requires reload.

LanguageRegex.hint: You can use this to change the term searched on items from "Language" to something else, like "Tongue". This setting is more useful for non-English speakers.
LanguageRegex.title: Language RegEx

POLYGLOT.logographicalFontToggle.hint: Halves the size of phrases using Logographical fonts (e.g. Japanese, Chinese characters).
POLYGLOT.logographicalFontToggle.title: Logographical Fonts
POLYGLOT.RandomizeRunes.hint: This determines which type of RNG is used to generate a phrase. ⚠️ The "None" option only supports Alphanumeric characters (no accents).
POLYGLOT.RandomizeRunes.title: Randomize Runes
POLYGLOT.ReplaceLanguages.hint: Replaces the system's default languages with your Custom Languages. The first language on the list becomes the new default language.
POLYGLOT.ReplaceLanguages.title: Replace System's Languages

RuneRegex.hint: Makes the randomization ignore non-alphanumerical characters (e.g. !,.;:?#$"'). This might have the undesired effect of showing some of those characters as a square (□) on some fonts.
RuneRegex.title: Randomize Only Alphanumericals

POLYGLOT.ScrambleGM.hint: Don't translate the text for the GM (refer to the globe's color for the token's understanding). Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.ScrambleGM.title: Scramble Messages for GM
POLYGLOT.Truespeech.hint: Set a language whose speaker understands all spoken languages (can't read Journals) and which is understood by all creatures. An actor will be able to read all chat messages and to write messages in a language that is understood by all.
POLYGLOT.Truespeech.title: Omnispeech Language

DND5E.SpecialLanguages.title: Replace Special Languages
DND5E.SpecialLanguages.hint: Name of the language that will replace "languages" such as "all the languages it knew in life".

TargetedParty.title: Target Group
TargetedParty.hint: If your game has a lot of users, the speaker indicator might become too crowded. You can filter the list by limiting it to users that own characters that are members of the target Group actor.

TargetedParty.title: Target Party
TargetedParty.hint: If your game has a lot of users, the speaker indicator might become too crowded. You can filter the list by limiting it to users that own characters that are members of the target Party actor.

AdditionalLanguageStat.title: Language Stat Key
AdditionalLanguageStat.hint: It is possible to target an Additional Stat (which is set on the SWADE Settings Configurator). You need to input the Stat Key (case sensitive). Beware that setting this overrides the {setting} setting.

AdditionalLiterateStat.title: Literacy Stat Key
AdditionalLiterateStat.hint: It is possible to limit reading journals by adding an Additional Stat. You need to input the Stat Key (case sensitive). This setting is independent from the {setting} setting.
